src:
元巡査部長、妻子３人殺害を否認…「間違いなく冤罪」

05 Nov 2019, 01:26

　福岡県小郡（おごおり）市の自宅で妻子３人を殺害したとして、殺人罪に問われた元県警巡査部長、中田充（みつる）被告（４１）（懲戒免職）の裁判員裁判の初公判が５日、福岡地裁（柴田寿宏裁判長）であった。中田被告は「一切身に覚えがない。事実無根です。間違いなく冤罪（えんざい）です」と起訴事実を全面的に否認し、無罪を主張した。
　起訴状では、中田被告は２０１７年６月５日深夜から同６日未明、同市の自宅で、妻・由紀子さん（当時３８歳）と小学４年の長男・涼介君（同９歳）、同１年の長女・実優（みゆ）さん（同６歳）の３人の首を圧迫したり、絞めたりして殺害したとしている。被告は当時、県警通信指令課に所属していた。
　検察側は冒頭陳述で、被告は０５年に由紀子さんと結婚して以降、由紀子さんから生活態度などを注意され、県警の同僚に「死んでほしい」と漏らすなど、由紀子さんへの不満を募らせていたと主張。残業と偽ってギャンブルなどに興じ、事件当日には、由紀子さんから励まされていた５回目の昇任試験に落ちたとの連絡があったことを指摘した。さらに、「被告には子ども２人を殺害する動機となり得る事情があった」と述べ、今後の証人尋問などで立証するとした。
　一方、弁護側は「一つ一つの証拠を積み重ねても、被告が犯人とは断定できない」と反論した。

Former General Manager, denies the killing of three wives and children ... "Definitely Atonement"

05 Nov 2019, 01:26

First presidency trial of Mitsuru Nakata defendant (41) (disciplinary dismissal) who was accused of murder for murdering three wives and children at home in Ogori City, Fukuoka Prefecture The trial was the Fukuoka District Court (Chairman Toshihiro Shibata) on the 5th. Defendant Nakata denies the fact of prosecution and asserted innocence, saying, “I don't remember anything at all.
According to the indictment, Defendant Nakata from midnight on June 5th, 2017 until dawn, at his home in the city, his wife, Yukiko (38 years old at that time), and his eldest son, Ryosuke (9 years old), One year old daughter, Miyu (six years old), was murdered by squeezing or strangling the necks of three people. The defendant belonged to the prefectural police communication command section at that time.
The prosecution made a statement at the beginning, and since the defendant married Yukiko in 2005, Yukiko was warned of the attitude of life and leaked to her prefectural police colleagues that she wanted to die. Insisted that it was. It was pointed out that on the day of the incident, Yukiko-san was informed that she had fallen to the fifth promotion exam that was encouraged. In addition, he stated that “the defendant had a situation that could be a motivation to kill two children,” he said.
On the other hand, the defense side countered that "accidents cannot be determined as criminals by accumulating each piece of evidence."
